intro: Rhexia flexuosa, commonly known as the zigzagflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its zigzagging stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Rhexia flexuosa thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
